text: Aldosterone is an important steroid hormone. It keeps sodium in the kidney, salivary glands, sweat glands, and colon. It plays a central role in the homeostatic regulation of blood pressure, plasma sodium (Na+), and potassium (K+) levels. Indirectly, it influences water retention or loss, blood pressure and blood volume. == References == Category:Steroid hormones
title: Aldosterone
